title: gzclient slow to load with many models due to shaders

content.raw: There were several comments on [drcsim issue 352](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/352/drc-practice-worlds-missing-models) ([here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/352/drc-practice-worlds-missing-models#comment-6218044) and [here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/352/drc-practice-worlds-missing-models#comment-6228033)) that the [drc_practice_task_2.world](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/src/d1aee3900bc8bd783a80cc1d36600aee50f52410/drcsim_model_resources/worlds/drc_practice_task_2.world?at=default) takes a long time to load in gzclient. I have confirm that gzserver can load the world relatively quickly, but that gzclient can take about 2 minutes to start. I ran `valgrind --callgrind gzclient` and found `gazebo::rendering::RTShaderSystem::GenerateShaders` to occupy 50% of the call time during startup (here's a [screenshot of kcachegrind](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/96660379/gazebo_GenerateShaders.png)).
content.html: There were several comments on drcsim issue 352 (here and here) that the drc_practice_task_2.world takes a long time to load in gzclient. I have confirm that gzserver can load the world relatively quickly, but that gzclient can take about 2 minutes to start. I ran valgrind --callgrind gzclient and found gazebo::rendering::RTShaderSystem::GenerateShaders to occupy 50% of the call time during startup (here's a screenshot of kcachegrind).
